article.headline: Southern Miss 79, Alcorn State 67
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Jasper Johnson had 18 points to lead Southern Mississippi to a 79-67 win over Alcorn State Friday. Three other Southern Miss players posted double-digit points -- Jason Forte had 13, Clement Carter added 12, and Greg Johnson had 10. Dante Stiggers had 10 assists for the Golden Eagles. "I thought we had some great peaks in the game," Southern Miss coach James Green said. "Our guys came out and played with great effort." The Braves (0-1) were led by DeAndre Jones, who had 21 points and was 5-for-7 from 3-point range. The Golden Eagles (1-0) led 43-32 lead at the break, but Alcorn (0-1) battled back with runs of 9-2 and 6-0 to pull to within two points, 51-49, with 13:33 to play. Southern Miss answered with a 14-4 run over the next five minutes to pull away for good. "You have to give Alcorn a lot of credit because they did a nice job and hit a lot of baskets to stay in the game," Green said. "But we responded. We made plays when they made plays, and we will only get better." Charles Gaines led the Golden Eagles with 10 rebounds. Jasper Johnson added nine. Alcorn's Myles Howard had a game-high 11 rebounds and had 14 points. Southern Miss shot 59 percent from the floor in the opening half. Jasper Johnson scored 14 of his 18 points in the first half.
